definition[0]: the process of judging officially how an argument should be settled
example[0]: The dispute is going to arbitration  (=someone is being asked to arbitrate).
example[1]: Both sides in the dispute have agreed to binding arbitration.
definition[1]: when a legal disagreement is dealt with by independent officials who have the authority to make a legal decision about it, rather than the case being dealt with in a court of law
example[2]: Disputes within the partnership can be referred to arbitration, avoiding the risks and costs of litigation.
definition[2]: when a disagreement between an employer and employees is dealt with by independent officials who try to reach an agreement between both sides in order to prevent a STRIKE or a legal battle
example[3]: Contract negotiations between them have reached deadlock and are likely to go to arbitration.
example[4]: The arbitration agreement only applied to the missing oil, not to the other allegations of wrongdoing.
